response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["age", "high", "At 18, the individual is very young, which is statistically linked to higher recidivism risk due to potential immaturity and increased impulsivity."],
    ["race", "low", "Identifying as White has not been strongly correlated with increased recidivism risk in most studies."],
    ["criminal_history", "medium", "Having one arrest with no conviction indicates some interaction with the justice system, suggesting moderate risk."],
    ["education", "low", "Holding a high school diploma and being enrolled in college are protective factors associated with lower recidivism risk."],
    ["employment", "medium", "Holding only one job in the past year indicates some workforce attachment but a relatively unstable employment record which can be a risk factor."],
    ["drug_use", "medium", "Recent use of marijuana suggests substance use involvement, which is moderately associated with higher recidivism risk."],
    ["marital_status", "medium", "Never having been married and living alone can indicate weaker social support structures, contributing modestly to recidivism risk."],
    ["childhood_environment", "medium", "Growing up in an urban setting in a larger household may be associated with increased exposure to higher-risk environments, though this effect is modest."],
    ["religious_beliefs", "medium", "Believing that God has nothing to do with personal events may reflect lower levels of religiosity, which can be linked to fewer community or moral supports that sometimes reduce recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: At 18, the individual is very young, which is statistically linked to higher recidivism risk due to potential immaturity and increased impulsivity.
Identifying as White has not been strongly correlated with increased recidivism risk in most studies.
Having one arrest with no conviction indicates some interaction with the justice system, suggesting moderate risk.
Holding a high school diploma and being enrolled in college are protective factors associated with lower recidivism risk.
Holding only one job in the past year indicates some workforce attachment but a relatively unstable employment record which can be a risk factor.
Recent use of marijuana suggests substance use involvement, which is moderately associated with higher recidivism risk.
Never having been married and living alone can indicate weaker social support structures, contributing modestly to recidivism risk.
Growing up in an urban setting in a larger household may be associated with increased exposure to higher-risk environments, though this effect is modest.
Believing that God has nothing to do with personal events may reflect lower levels of religiosity, which can be linked to fewer community or moral supports that sometimes reduce recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 170 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological dad in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
